alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Smith and northwestern Cherokee Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Berryville, or 11 miles northwest of Jacksonville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Bullard, Troup, Mount Selman, Mixon, Reese, Lake Palestine, New Summerfield, Gallatin, Cuney and Teaselville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Texas.
